title: Citation graph - Topic extraction, recommendation, and Bloom exploration

parameters.neodash_title: Modeling of architectures with UML panel

reports.title: Summary
reports.query:
**Citation graph in scientific research**

The data used is from the DBLP Citation Network, which includes citation data from various academic sources.
You can recreate the database with [this guide](https://neo4j.com/developer/graph-data-science/link-prediction/graph-data-science-library/).

This dashboard will explore the following use cases :
- Topic extraction
- Recommendation
- Using Bloom with NeoDash to extend the data exploration capabilities

But first, here is an overview of the data.

reports.title: A sample of the graph with some citations
reports.query: MATCH p=(n)-[e]->(m) RETURN n,e,m LIMIT 18

reports.title: Data model
reports.query: CALL db.schema.visualization()

reports.title: Some articles
reports.query:
MATCH (n:Article)--(v:Venue)
WHERE EXISTS(n.abstract)
RETURN n.title as title, n.abstract as abstract, v.name as published_for LIMIT 50

reports.title: Number of articles
reports.query: MATCH (n:Article) RETURN count(n)

reports.title: Number of citations
reports.query:
MATCH ()-[rel:CITED]->()
RETURN count(rel)

reports.title: Article clusters in Bloom - set username "citation" and password "citation" to view the perspective.
reports.query: https://bloom.neo4j.io/index.html?connectURL=neo4j%2Bs%3A%2F%2Facb5b6ae.databases.neo4j.io&search=Article%20cited%20Article%20cited%20Article&run=true

reports.title: # of distinct clusters
reports.query:
MATCH (n:Article)
WITH n.wcc as community, count(n) as communitySize
WHERE communitySize > 1
RETURN count(DISTINCT community)

reports.title: What's next?
reports.query:
**This means we can run community detection algorithms!**

First of all, here's an analysis using the Weakly Connected Components, which identifies disjoint clusters.
Two nodes are in disjoint clusters if no path exists between them.

reports.title: Biggest community has :
reports.query:
MATCH (n:Article)
WITH n.wcc as community, count(n) as communitySize
RETURN toString(max(communitySize)) + ' Articles'

reports.title: Topic extraction
reports.query:
Inside of that big community of 14k articles we've identified, let's see if we can identify different topics.

For this, we will identify communities of articles that cite each other ; and then, find the most influential article in each community.
This can be used as the topic for that community.

reports.title: Louvain detected :
reports.query:
MATCH (n:Article)
WHERE EXISTS(n.louvain)
RETURN toString(count(DISTINCT n.louvain)) + " communities"

reports.title: You might see "disconnected islands" because not all nodes and relationships are displayed.
reports.query: https://bloom.neo4j.io/index.html?connectURL=neo4j%2Bs%3A%2F%2Facb5b6ae.databases.neo4j.io&search=Article%20cited%20Article%20with%20wcc%200&run=true

settings.description:
Set username "citation" and password "citation" to view the perspective.

Be aware that this Bloom view limits the number of nodes displayed. So you might see "disconnected islands" because not all nodes and relationships are displayed.

reports.title: Click on a community number to update view
reports.query:
MATCH (n:Article)
WHERE EXISTS(n.louvain)
WITH toString(n.louvain) as community, n.pagerank as pagerank, n.title as title ORDER BY pagerank DESC
WITH community, head(collect(title)) AS summary, head(collect(pagerank)) AS pagerank
RETURN community, summary

reports.title: Top 10 topics
reports.query:
MATCH (n:Article)
WHERE EXISTS(n.louvain)
WITH n.louvain as community, n.pagerank as pagerank, n.title as title, n ORDER BY pagerank DESC
WITH community, head(collect(title)) AS summary, count(n) as count LIMIT 10
RETURN summary, count

reports.title: Size indicates an Article's influence - Biggest node for a given community = topic
reports.query: https://bloom.neo4j.io/index.html?connectURL=neo4j%2Bs%3A%2F%2Facb5b6ae.databases.neo4j.io&run=true&search=Article%20louvain%20$neodash_community_property%20cited%20Article%20louvain%20 $neodash_community_property

settings.description: Set username "citation" and password "citation" to view the perspective.

reports.title: Pick an article you like (a random one is also fine)
reports.query:
MATCH (n:Article WHERE EXISTS(n.louvain))
RETURN "Click me" AS click, n.title AS title LIMIT 100

reports.title: Recommended articles - Same topic
reports.query:
MATCH (n:Article WHERE n.title=$neodash_title)
MATCH (m:Article WHERE m.louvain=n.louvain)
WITH n, m ORDER BY m.pagerank DESC LIMIT 5
RETURN n.title AS `You read`, m.title AS `Read next`

reports.title: Some explanations
reports.query:
To make recommendations based on our current data, the process is the following, you can go two ways :
- Pick the articles with the top PageRank scores in the *same* community (same topic)
- Pick the articles with the top PageRank scores in a *different* community (related topic)

To try it out, **pick an article** to the left, and see the results below.

reports.title: Recommended articles - Related topic
reports.query:
MATCH (n:Article WHERE n.title=$neodash_title)
MATCH (m:Article WHERE m.louvain=n.louvain)
WITH n, m ORDER BY m.pagerank DESC LIMIT 5
MATCH (o:Article WHERE NOT o.louvain=n.louvain)-[:CITED]-(m)
WITH n, m, o ORDER BY o.pagerank DESC LIMIT 5
RETURN o.title AS `Read next`
